titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the photograph album Vers la Tunisie...Sur le "Kairouan" (A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan) AD.MC.043
titlestmt.author: Jasmine Soliman and Jonathan Burr for Akkasah Photography Archive, NYUAD

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 19:25:16 +0400.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: French, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Vers la Tunisie...Sur le "Kairouan" (A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan)

physdesc.extent: 107 gelatin silver photographs contained within an album measuring 36 x 25 cm

did.abstract: A travel album of a trip to Tunisia from Marseille on the ship "Kairouan" circa 1950s, containing 107 gelatin silver photographs. Places visited are: Tunis, Carthage, Sidi Bou Said, Nabeul, Hammamet, Monastie, Mahdia, Sousse,El Djem, Gabes, Sfax, Matmatas, Douiret, Djerba, Gafsa, Medenine and Kairouan. Creator unknown.
did.physdesc: Excellent condition. No tears or foxing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection processed as it was received.

scopecontent.head: Content Description
scopecontent.p: A travel album of Tunisia containing 107 gelatin silver photographs as well as clippings and postcards. The journey from Marseille, France to Tunis, Tunisia, was made on the ship "Kairouan". Places visited are: Tunis, Carthage, Sidi Bou Said, Nabeul, Hammamet, Monastie, Mahdia, Sousse,El Djem, Gabes, Sfax, Matmatas, Douirot, Djerba, Gafsa, Medenine and Kairouan. The images focus on historical sites, architecture, mosques, a synagogue and the local population - many of these include Tunisian artisans, market traders and agricultural workers. The clippings and postcards mainly depict orientalist tropes.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Creator unknown. Photographs taken during a trip from Marseille to Tunis, circa 1950s. Captions are in French and contain racist and culturally insensitive remarks.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Repository permission is required for access. Please contact Akkasah: Photography Archive, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Repository permission is required for use. Please contact Akkasah: Photography Archive, akkasah@nyu.edu +971 2628 5531 or submit an image request form: https://akkasah.org/en/page/frontpage/image-request

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Trip to Tunisia on the Kairouan / ADMC043, Akkasah: Photography Archive, New York University Abu Dhabi.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Materials were placed in an acid-free sleeve and box. Original caption information, when available, will be transcribed into page-level descriptions. Where captions are illegible, the archivist's interpretation is enclosed in square brackets.

did.unittitle: A page entitled 'The jobs of Tunisians (Les occupations des Tunisiens).' From the left clockwise: clippings of a woman begging, artisans weaving, a postcard of a group of people, and a group at a restaurant (Please note: This material has been digitized in its entirety and contains racist and culturally insensitive remarks).
